document.title: HEIDENHAIN Controller TNC on HARTFORD Machine

branches.name: 340590 07 SP5 Running HEROS 5.08.3 controlling HARTFORD 5A-65E CNC machine

product.name: HEIDENHAIN TNC 640 controlling a HARTFORD 5A-65E CNC machine - HEIDENHAIN Controller TNC 640: Version 340590 07 SP5 Running HEROS 5.08.3 controlling HARTFORD 5A-65E CNC machine

branches.name: HEIDENHAIN TNC 640 controlling a HARTFORD 5A-65E CNC machine

notes.text: The HEIDENHAIN Controller TNC 640, version 340590 07 SP5, running HEROS 5.08.3 controlling the HARTFORD 5A-65E CNC machine is vulnerable to improper authentication, which may allow an attacker to deny service to the production line, steal sensitive data from the production line, and alter any products created by the production line.CVE-2022-41648 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.1 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: HEIDENHAIN is working with HARTFORD Machinery of She Hong Industrial Co. Ltd. to develop mitigations.
Block LSV2 and DNC communication by means of the integrated firewall in the controller's HEROS operating system
Use zone-firewalls to isolate and segment the network of the affected devices
Ask your machinery vendor (running HEIDENHAIN controllers) for updates to a recent Software-Version, where SSH-tunneling is standard
